response.overview: CHICAGO II (STEVEN WILSON REMIX) features a brand new Dolby ATMOS mix, along with stereo, quadrophonic, and 5.1 mixes in high-resolution.  Fifty-five years after its debut, CHICAGO II still sounds like nothing else. Released in 1970, Chicago’s second album brims with confidence and inspiration as it draws on everything from orchestral music to heavy rock. Although it never affected the record’s popularity – it peaked at #4 on the album chart and spawned a trio of Top Ten hits.  CHICAGO II has been remixed before, but now, for the first time, a Dolby ATMOS of the 16-track album will be revealed. The album previously received stereo, quadrophonic, and 5.1 hi-res mixes from the multi-track tapes, making it possible for Steven Wilson to bring out elements that were muffled or submerged in the mix. This resulted in a version of CHICAGO II that boasts clearness, punch and definition that it didn’t have before.
response.title: Chicago II
